documents.document: @Michael_J_Parry can't comment on the transphobic but the feminist girl in me is a bit gut reaction offended
@NZStuff and to make it worse you put a pic of the sisters holding trophies onto the hotel story... hoping this was accident, guessing not
@NZStuff Serena wins 23rd title & you lead with a hotel bill Tennis Auck has no qualms with, burying the story of her record breaking win
Tietjens is now coaching Samoa!! I might be a little slow to pick up on this, sorry. But how awesome is that.
Why do I like Netflix more than tvnz? Well for a start they tell me when my fav shows are back and always offer it on demand
Dirk Gently binge over. Holy cow Batman that was freakin awesome.
@Michael_J_Parry Sometimes it's just in your head :-) I had that for days after the big one, turned out to be phantom quakes
Sorry, I'll stop. Positive thoughts... Amy Schumer will be a kick ass Barbie
And a zillion rules already in place to ensure the standard of the neighbourhood is maintained, and residents still object
This bollocks makes me really angry, Wellington needs more houses, here is a great tract of flat land, motorway access, bus service in place
That mix of housing makes it exactly the same as that top end of Mark Ave... And you can't tell which are which from the street
$450-550k isn't affordable and it's rubbish to suggest those houses will devalue that end of Grenada Village
Got to love Lady Gaga - that act of kindness is inspiring https://t.co/oG2XkM8exV
@gmail fixed, it was my iPad being silly and not your app
@gmail thanks - yes, my account is fine, I can use in Safari. It's the app itself crashing immediately. No problem before 5.0.6 update
@laurasolomon @libfocus reflecting their end-users needs in a user centric way
@gmail Any idea why app won't open since app update? It opens split second then close. iPad 9.3.1. I tried re-insta… https://t.co/bAN9JAei1P
And I've just found out his name was Daniel White. Thanks for the music, Daniel White, it was perfect 2/2
On Lambton Quay at lunchtime I went past a busker and I thought yeah, that music is spot on, it was super calming, exactly what I needed 1/2
Bloody phantom earthquakes are making me seasick again
@gmail yes, it does. And full credit for quick reply with a *helpful* answer. (I'd still like my inbox back... maybe next app upgrade)
Hate the new gmail app. No inbox have to see everything and can't select emails to delete, have to delete individually. Not happy
Electing a non-politician is a gamble but after Brexit not surprising, Trump might have fuelled the fire but he didn't start it
Admittedly I do like being right & I called it from the start... but I'm still a bit shocked I even had my so I was wrong speech ready to go
@MicrosoftHelps so you are saying dots going in circles for 26 hours on a computer that was up-to-date last week is… https://t.co/mQa53bfd4Z
@MicrosoftHelps what should I do? The little dots have been going around in circles for 5.5 hours, normally only takes 30 mins or so
5 hours still dots going around @MicrosoftHelps what was in those updates? Is my laptop going to be ok?
2.5 hours and still going... wtf Microsoft
Up to date security is pointless if I get so bored waiting I give up every time and use my always-ready-never-makes-me-wait iPad
This thing where you make me wait for over an hour every time I want to use my @Microsoft Win10 laptop while it install updates is a joke
@wizzyrea not easy with adults either :-(
That traffic cone is impressively high... Drone? Climbing seems ambitious even for drunk students
Memo to self: next time you see person on the bus playing a game you want do not download especially if it has 1000 levels...
Wonder if the App Store has thought about adding an addiction rating... maybe infuriatingly addictive to you want to win but no biggie
Can I see these pillows out of the boxes? No, there are some on display over there. Do you have these two on display? No.
@DrLibbyLive I can't follow your Facebook links. Presumably because like lots of people I don't have a FB account.… https://t.co/vx5NBVXm5v
Finally made it home from #uxlibsnz fantastic day, but can we do Wellington next time please, the 4.30am start was rough
How the hell did a regional councillor get my cell phone number? Unsolicited crap belongs on a landline
<sigh> opened Twitter to say - Sophie Pascoe is awesome
Its ok on phone, but infuriating on iPad.. Lots of swearing until I remember you have to view horizontal if you want navigation
Wonder if the hotmail / outlook live people ever user tested on a tablet? It's only my backup email but it does my head in every time
Gosh that looked a lot like snow.
. @ajtarbotton It was but everyone joining closed groups wrecked it
Just registered for #uxlibsnz and am very very excited !!
If it's true then well done @TVNZ for hiring based on skills and personality and not sticking with the gender/age status quo
Just published 'Library service design' book arrived on my desk today, I've only flicked through so far but is already my new favourite
Tom Hiddleston is OK I guess, better than some other suggestions for #jamesbond but for me there is only #idriselba
great thing about following people you don't know is the intriguing mysterious posts in your timeline.. like messages from another universe
Turns out all my plans for tonight involved electricity, and sadly I have none
Thanks @sallyheroes @schomj Finding a summary like this for colleagues was on my to-do list for next week... This is great
@ajtarbotton but what if you got users to mark pages for you with what they think each thing does, has potential as a quick UX tool 2/2
@ajtarbotton first thing I thought was info lit, until I remembered UX would say pages should make sense without needing to be annotated 1/2
Thanks @ajtarbotton @sallyheroes It could be a good way to add a layer to an infographic or poster, a bit more info for those that want
Yay @WellingtonZoo is getting wombats and leopards !!
I feel like kindness is under-valued. Everyone who has inspired me recently has gone out of their way to be kind to someone just because
<Sigh> and then when it still doesn't work, accept you needed to do what the kid actually said
What do u do when u can't find the answer to a tech question on Google? Go to You Tube where a 10 year old child will step you through it...
Said at the start Trump would get to here. Have a feeling it's a long way from over. Pretty please can I be wrong this time
@briarunit @sallyheroes I've got that one but prefer Useful usable desirable, it's more help when trying to explain UX to colleagues
@sallyheroes @briarunit Me too. I started redesigning databases page a while ago. Was looking at tags but website won't support
@briarunit @sallyheroes lots of libraries have database pages like they ended up with so really interesting to see UX on it
@briarunit @sallyheroes Have thought for a while libraries need to embrace UX more, useful article, captures the different perspectives...
@wizzyrea People seem to forget taxes pay for things like hospitals. Can't have tax cuts and fund more medicine/surgeries.
@wizzyrea I reckon they should ban tax cuts as election bribes. That is all this is, they even said so.
Tonight I saw Jupiter, Saturn, Mars and craters on the moon. Think Jupiter was my favourite, had 3 moons of its own. Saturn close behind
If you are only going to show me this once maybe don't send me seven emails. More you send me less I think it's gonna be worth looking...
Was hoping 40s would be the decade I did not get ID'd. Anyone who tells you to be happy you look so young should try it.
@Michael_J_Parry <sigh> jealous... I'd go straw bale earthship... Got the impression nz councils aren't easy to convince about straw bale
So good - David Gilmour blends purple rain guitar solo into comfortably numb https://t.co/DvzDcGB4n8
Left home early bus was no show. Now I'm very late. Thanks Newlands Coach Services - really loving your new 'reliable' bus timetables
Met a couple of red pandas at @WellingtonZoo experience today, they were adorably cute and very friendly... Might have to do another one...
@nohbrien have had few jobs with gender neutral bathrooms, was a non issue for men and woman.
And no having it delivered to my house would not be more convenient thank you I won’t be there & then I’ll have to f around with redelivery
I miss being able to buy what I want in physical shops… tired of trying to guess if I’ll like something or if it’ll fit based on a picture
Why do library catalogues/databases just say ‘student’? Surely anyone doing research wants to know if they’re primary students or tertiary…
@ajwillemse91 @sallyheroes @briarunit discovery is great, but need to really understand where it fits in for your users, is just one tool
@ajwillemse91 @sallyheroes @briarunit seems like discovery is making curation more necessary, least is true for us. Discovery too much 2/2
@ajwillemse91 @sallyheroes @briarunit don’t think so. Currently trialling curated product from publishers of our discovery layer 1/2
@ajwillemse91 @sallyheroes @briarunit what do you call lists/curation on website/blog? Been hunting other library websites, not helping me
@ajwillemse91 @sallyheroes @briarunit personally think lists contribute to info overload. curation is part of answer, the filter is wanted
@ajwillemse91 @sallyheroes @briarunit Agree, but is your knowledge & experience of their needs that adds value.
@sallyheroes @ajwillemse91 @briarunit difference b/wn list and curation has been bit of an issue recently - looking forward to blog post 2/2
@sallyheroes @ajwillemse91 @briarunit objectivity should be a lost cause, more value to user from curating based on them (1/2)
@wizzyrea I’m still miffed at them for dumping Kari Tory & Grant.
@Michael_J_Parry Congrats! Um you’ve kind of restored my faith in people a bit, is a lot to be said for just accepting people as they are…
